channel.title: Oh SHIT
channel.description: Well, I just bought windows vista, attempted to install it annnnnnd.....oh SHIT. My drive format isnt NTFS. What the hell do I do now?!?! I can't change it without it deleting everything there, which would stuff up my computer!

item.title: Oh SHIT
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

[quote=“OWNER 2007, post:4, topic:158608”][quote author=Iamadam link=topic=216139.msg1883189#msg1883189 date=1195205518]
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb456984.aspx
[/quote]Thanks a TRILLION. Just one thing. It says “Enter current volume label for drive C:”. How do I find that out?[/quote]

Leave volume label blank. It’s basically what you want to name your hard drive.

item.title: Oh SHIT
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Back your “shit” up onto a portable hard drive, or a CD, or put it on a website that gives you some space, and install…

Also, vista isn’t too good to tell the truth…

It uses your hard drive 24/7.
CPU usage is almost always under 50%, but your hard drive slows everything down.
It is worse than windows XP

Just try it for a month… Then go back to XP. You will see the difference of how fast windows XP is faster than vista.

Read full topic
